content: Initially, I only wanted the statement that if a function is monotone_on a set s, then it is bounded on that set. I thought that I could get away with adding some monotone_on lemmas in order.bounds but we seem to be missing bdd_above_on/bdd_below_on in mathlib. I am planning to work on adding this soon but first I think I should ask if there are any objections?

docs#bdd_above is for sets, not for functions. So I'm not sure what you mean by bdd_above_on.
Note that we can say that a function is bounded above on a set by saying bdd_above (f '' s), such as in e.g. docs#is_compact.bdd_above_image.
